title: How to Check and Listen to Your Xfinity Voice Voicemail

steps.title: Dial *99 or your Xfinity phone number.
steps.content: Dial *99 or your Xfinity phone number. If you're calling from your Xfinity phone, dial *99. However, if you want to check your voicemail from a different phone, such as a mobile phone or landline away from home, dial your Xfinity phone number instead. Your phone line will ring until the voicemail picks up.

steps.title: Press # when the voicemail picks up.
steps.content: Press # when the voicemail picks up. It's the symbol that looks like a hashtag on your phone's dialpad. You'll be asked to enter your Xfinity Voice passcode.

steps.title: Enter your Xfinity Voice passcode.
steps.content: Enter your Xfinity Voice passcode. This is a 4-digit PIN. If you're a new customer, you should have received this number through an automated phone call or by mail. After you successfully enter your passcode, you will be able to control and access your voicemail. [1] X Research source Press 1 for password change. Press 2 for administrative options, like changing your voicemail greeting. Press 4 for personal options, such as changing administration options, greetings or recorded name, personal greeting, and more. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Sign into https://connect.xfinity.com/voice/voicemail.
steps.content: Sign into https://connect.xfinity.com/voice/voicemail . You can access this website from any computer, phone, or tablet. If you're not already signed in to your Xfinity account, enter your Xfinity ID and password to do so now. You should see a list of all your saved voicemails.

steps.title: Click the Play button next to the voicemail.
steps.content: Click the Play button next to the voicemail. This will play the voice message. Once a voicemail is played, it will be marked as "Heard".

steps.title: Delete a voicemail (optional).
steps.content: Delete a voicemail (optional). If you don't want a voice message in your inbox, you can easily delete it. Do the following: Click ☰ on the right of the message. Click Send to Trash .

steps.title: Download a voicemail (optional).
steps.content: Download a voicemail (optional). The Xfinity Voice voicemail can hold about 85 minutes of voicemails. If you need to free up some space but don't want to delete any messages, you can download it to your device. Do the following: Click ☰ on the right of the message. Click Download Voicemail . Alternatively, you can also save a voicemail on your iPhone or Android device .

steps.title: Dial *99 or your Xfinity phone number.
steps.content: Dial *99 or your Xfinity phone number. If you're calling from your Xfinity phone, dial *99. However, if you want to check your voicemail from a different phone, such as a mobile phone or landline away from home, dial your Xfinity phone number instead. If you want your voicemail to automatically play a new message once you dial in rather than be prompted by the system, you can change your automatic playback settings.

steps.title: Press # when the voicemail picks up.
steps.content: Press # when the voicemail picks up. It's the symbol that looks like a hashtag on your phone's dialpad.

steps.title: Enter your Xfinity Voice passcode.
steps.content: Enter your Xfinity Voice passcode. This is a 4-digit PIN.

steps.title: Press 4.
steps.content: Press 4 . This will select personal options .

steps.title: Press 2.
steps.content: Press 2 . This will select administrative options .

steps.title: Press 1.
steps.content: Press 1 . This will select general options .

steps.title: Press 4.
steps.content: Press 4 . This will select message detail playback options .

steps.title: Press 1 or 2.
steps.content: Press 1 or 2 . Press 1 if you want to change the automatic playback of the date/time for each voice message. Press 2 if you want to change the automatic playback of the name of the person leaving the voice message. Once your settings have been set, you can end the call.

steps.title: Sign into https://connect.xfinity.com/voice/settings/voicemailsettings.
steps.content: Sign into https://connect.xfinity.com/voice/settings/voicemailsettings . You can access this website from any computer, phone, or tablet. If you're not already signed in to your Xfinity account, enter your Xfinity ID and password to do so now.

steps.title: Click Checking Voicemail.
steps.content: Click Checking Voicemail . This is in the left panel. If you're already on this tab, skip this step.

steps.title: Toggle on Playback settings.
steps.content: Toggle on Playback settings. Click the switch to toggle on the options for: Automatically play my new message when I dial into my voicemail and/or Announce the date and time when playing voicemails .

steps.title: Xfinity voicemail can hold 10 MB of audio.
steps.content: Xfinity voicemail can hold 10 MB of audio. This is about 85 minutes of saved voice messages. If your voicemail is at full capacity, callers won't be able to leave any new voicemails on your account. Luckily, you should receive an email and a voice message from Xfinity alerting you that your mailbox is almost full. If you delete voice messages, be sure to empty your trash bin, since this can count towards your storage limit.
